meanings.definition: To write over something already written.
meanings.sent1: She kept overwriting her mistakes on the paper until it was unreadable.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally started overwriting my notes with new information.
meanings.sent3: The computer was so confused by the constant overwriting that it crashed.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like an overwriting process, each new experience erasing the old.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush moved swiftly, overwriting the previous strokes with bold new colors.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing or erasing existing data with new data.
meanings.sent1: The overwriting of the file caused all the previous information to be lost.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to create a backup to prevent accidental overwriting of important files.
meanings.sent3: The overwriting of the document was so thorough that even the original author couldn't recognize it.
meanings.sent4: The overwriting of memories in the brain is a complex and fascinating process.
meanings.sent5: The overwriting of the hard drive was like a digital clean slate, ready for new information.
